Name: Confidence Threshold Estimator
Purpose: Estimate the minimum perceived understanding and certainty levels a young professional needs before they will execute an investment decision, and determine where they currently fall relative to that threshold.
Deliverables: Quantified confidence threshold curves for different decision types (starting to invest, increasing contributions, changing asset mix); mapping from observable indicators (time spent, questions asked, hesitation patterns) to an estimated current confidence state; gap analysis specifying which dimensions of confidence (knowledge, trust in system, perceived downside risk) must be raised to cross the action threshold.
Strengths: Good at distinguishing between users who are ready but hesitant vs. those who are genuinely underinformed; aligns barrier analysis with actual action-readiness rather than abstract knowledge levels; supports targeted, just-enough interventions.
Watch-out: Breaks when user actions are driven by external mandates or social pressure rather than internal confidence; can mis-estimate thresholds if it assumes stable risk preferences or ignores situational volatility (e.g., market shocks, job insecurity).
